item.title: } else { Problem
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“C4ll3r, post:23, topic:286535”]All my codes what i used:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("event") && playerRights >= 2) { if(!event) event = true; sendMessage("The event has been turned " + (event ? "on" : "Off") + "!"); else return; }

public boolean event = false;

[code]
case 2468:
if (event) {
teleportToX = 2439;
teleportToY = 5169;
sendMessage(“You enter the event zone”);
else
sendMessage("Sorry the event needs to be started by an

administrator.");
}
break;[/code][/quote]
And that is why you should always have braces on your if statements…

Read full topic

item.title: } else { Problem
item.dc:creator: @moparclient moparclient
item.description:
@moparclient wrote:

Just use this… OBS: i just wrote down from scrath

case 2468: if (event == true) { sendMessage("You enter the event zone"); teleportToX = 2439; teleportToY = 5169; } if (event == false) { sendMessage("Sorry the event needs to be started by an administrator."); } break;

item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:26, topic:286535”]change } esle { to if {? idk i’m f’ing confused[/quote]I missed this in my previous quote, if you don’t know don’t help, or post.

[quote=“Anfernio, post:29, topic:286535”]case 2468: if(event) { sendMessage("You enter the event."); teleportToX = 2439; teleportToY = 5169; } else { sendMessage("Sorry, the event needs to be started by an administrator."); }
There was no reason for

break; [/quote]
Visit Java Tutorials come back and tell us.

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:21, topic:286535”]also, why’s there a gap between
sendMessage("Sorry the event needs to be started by an

administrator.");[/quote]Pretty hard to read, I also have no idea why there is a space.

item.title: } else { Problem
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:16, topic:286535”]I think you’re supposed to put send message under the coords instead of above them. I think, but I’m not positive about it[/quote]No, it does not matter where you place it, as long as it’s inside the case.

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:19, topic:286535”]make it } else if { or } if else { I geuss[/quote]} if else { does not exist, and as already said before, } else if { has a different effect.

Read full topic

item.title: } else { Problem
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“Tico, post:17, topic:286535”]http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/if.html

It really isn’t that hard, guys.[/quote]

Didn’t you guys notice this post at all? Here’s an example from that page that you can use as an example to fix your problem.

void applyBrakes() { if (isMoving) { currentSpeed--; } else { System.err.println("The bicycle has already stopped!"); } }

item.title: } else { Problem
item.dc:creator: @C4ll3r C4ll3r
item.description:
@C4ll3r wrote:

what do you mean???[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 01, 2009, 04:47:59 pm[/size][hr]I will just post my whole Click one

[code]/OBJECT CLICK ONE/

public void objectClick(int objectID, int objectX, int

objectY, int face, int face2, int GateID) {
try {
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(ServerCP.Owner))
println(“atObject: “+objectX+”,”+objectY+"

objectID: "+objectID);

switch(objectID) {
//fight caves
case 9356:
respawnneeded = 1;
teleportToX = 2396;
teleportToY = 5086;
heightLevel = server.caveheight;
server.caveheight += 1;
sendMessage(“Goodluck Adventurer.”);
break;
case 9357:
sendMessage(“You Leave The Fight Caves.”);
respawnneeded = 0;
teleportToX = 2439;
teleportToY = 5169;
break;
//end fight caves
//altar
case 409:
setSkillLevel(5, getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]),

playerXP[5]);
playerLevel[5] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]);
refreshSkills();
setAnimation(645);
sendMessage(“You recharge your prayer”);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
break;

case 2468:
if(event) {
sendMessage(“You enter the event zone”);
teleportToX = 2439;
teleportToY = 5169;
} else {
sendMessage("Sorry the event needs to be started by an

administrator.");
}
break;
//end altar
//------------------tj007razor: mining----------------

case 453: //“mining” empty ore
case 452: //“mining” empty ore
case 451: //“mining” empty ore
case 450: //“mining” empty ore
sendMessage(“There is no ore left in this rock.”);
break;

/**
*startMine(rock index, level requirement, item to add,

XP multiplier, objectID, objectX, objectY);
**/

case 2091: //mining bronze ore, first rock type [0]
startMine(0, 0, 436, 20, 2091, objectX, objectY);
break;

case 2093: //mining iron ore, second rock type [1]
startMine(1, 20, 440, 50, 2093, objectX, objectY);
break;

case 2103: //mining mith ore, forth rock type [3]
startMine(3, 45, 447, 85, 2103, objectX, objectY);
break;

case 2105: //mining addy ore, fifth rock type [4]
startMine(4, 55, 449, 130, 2105, objectX, objectY);
break;

case 2107: //mining rune ore, sixth rock type [5]
startMine(5, 75, 451, 185, 2107, objectX, objectY);
break;

case 2111: //mining elemental(dragon) ore, seventh rock

type [6]
startMine(6, 80, 2893, 150, 2111, objectX, objectY);
break;

//------------------------end mining------------------

default:

break;
}
} catch(Exception E) {
}
}[/code]
